## MATHEMATICS

9709/22

You will need: List of formulae (MF19)  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 418, 225, 434]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 435, 875, 632]]<|/det|>
INSTRUCTIONS- Answer all questions.- Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.- Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.- Write your answer to each question in the space provided.- Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.- Do not write on any bar codes.- If additional space is needed, you should use the lined page at the end of this booklet; the question number or numbers must be clearly shown.- You should use a calculator where appropriate.- You must show all necessary working clearly; no marks will be given for unsupported answers from a calculator.- Give non-exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 664, 216, 679]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 680, 732, 712]]<|/det|>
INFORMATION- The total mark for this paper is 50.- The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 99, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 148, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 712, 92]]<|/det|>
Sketch, on the same diagram, the graphs of \(y = |3x - 5|\) and \(y = x + 2\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 73, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 440, 148, 459]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 440, 438, 459]]<|/det|>
Solve the equation \(|3x - 5| = x + 2\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 440, 920, 459]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 74, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 437, 92]]<|/det|>
The parametric equations of a curve are

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[374, 100, 621, 120]]<|/det|>
\[x = \mathrm{e}^{2t}\cos 4t,\qquad y = 3\sin 2t.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 127, 581, 145]]<|/det|>
Find the gradient of the curve at the point for which \(t = 0\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 127, 920, 145]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 148, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 920, 107]]<|/det|>
Use the trapezium rule with two intervals to find an approximation to the area of the shaded region. Give your answer correct to 2 significant figures.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 87, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 688, 186, 707]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 688, 920, 722]]<|/det|>
State, with a reason, whether your answer to part (b) is an over-estimate or under-estimate of the exact area of the shaded region.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 705, 920, 724]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 82, 146, 101]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 72, 611, 109]]<|/det|>
It is given that the equation \(x = \sqrt{\frac{9}{x + 2}}\) has a single root.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 120, 630, 139]]<|/det|>
Show by calculation that this root lies between 1.5 and 2.0.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 120, 920, 139]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 525, 186, 544]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 523, 920, 560]]<|/det|>
Use an iterative formula, based on the equation in part (b), to find the root correct to 3 significant figures. Give the result of each iteration to 5 significant figures.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 540, 920, 559]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 96, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>6</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 393, 92]]<|/det|>
The polynomial \(\mathrm{p}(x)\) is defined by

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[421, 100, 576, 120]]<|/det|>
\[\mathrm{p}(x) = x^{3} + ax + b,\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 127, 920, 163]]<|/det|>
where \(a\) and \(b\) are constants. It is given that \((x + 2)\) is a factor of \(\mathrm{p}(x)\) and that the remainder is 5 when \(\mathrm{p}(x)\) is divided by \((x - 3)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 173, 146, 191]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 173, 373, 191]]<|/det|>
Find the values of \(a\) and \(b\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 174, 920, 191]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 148, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 576, 92]]<|/det|>
Hence find the exact root of the equation \(\mathrm{p}(\mathrm{e}^{2\mathrm{y}}) = 0\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 73, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 73, 99, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>7</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 148, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 72, 801, 92]]<|/det|>
Express \(5\sqrt{3}\cos x + 5\sin x\) in the form \(R\cos (x - \alpha)\), where \(R > 0\) and \(0< \alpha < \frac{1}{2}\pi\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 73, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 616, 186, 635]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 612, 500, 633]]<|/det|>
As \(x\) varies, find the least possible value of

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[406, 637, 589, 658]]<|/det|>
\[4 + 5\sqrt{3}\cos x + 5\sin x,\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 666, 653, 685]]<|/det|>
and determine the corresponding value of \(x\) where \(-\pi < x < \pi\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 666, 920, 685]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[428, 74, 569, 92]]<|/det|>
